author: g11tech
content:
fellow devs: have added a `set` method to the 2935 contract (on lines of 4788) which clients are free to use to update 2935 history instead of doing direct update:

https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/8596

would like the new contract to be used for devnet 1, so if anyone wanna review the PR, please feel free before we merge it

cc <@543900561460822016> <@508125616940515329> <@686695036733227017> <@199561711278227457> <@412614104222531604> <@552133098075193354> <@353136597522448385>

Also please note that the EIP 2935 has been modified/refactored from devnet 0 usage based on the interop feedback, so please do read the EIP in full 
(tldr: 
i) eip only writes the parent hash on each block in the contract, 
ii) no more "backfill" of previous hashes on fork block, and 
iii) the BLOCKHASH continues to be resolved in the same way as before (and only for 256 hashes not 8192 that would be available in 2935 contract) and not from state unless some client wants to optionally leverage the state hashes if they don't have the history). Reading from state (or atleast charging gas/accesses for it) is now in a new EIP (https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-7709) which we plan to activate on verkle to enable stateless client execution but doesn't activate on pectra
